quizzes.question: What are the functions of the "nowrap" option?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The white-space Property[/h1] The white-space property specifies how white-space inside an element is handled. The values can be set as [b]normal[/b], [b]inherit[/b], [b]nowrap[/b], etc. The nowrap value suppresses all line breaks in the element. [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]

This paragraph has multiple spaces and a line break, but it will be ignored, as we used the nowrap value.

[/code] [b]The CSS: [/b][code format="css" codeId="535"]p { white-space: nowrap; }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2611" width="100%"] [note]The text will continue on the same line until a [b]
[/b] tag is encountered. [/note]

answers.text: "pre" accepts all line-breaks and whitespace, while "pre-line" ignores the whitespace
"pre-line" accepts all line-breaks and whitespace, while "pre" ignores the line-breaks

quizzes.question: What is the difference between the "pre" and "pre-line" options?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The white-space Values[/h1] The white-space property also supports other values: [b]pre[/b] - text will only wrap on line breaks and white space [b]pre-line[/b] - text will wrap where there is a break in code, but extra white space is still ignored [b]pre-wrap[/b] - text will wrap when necessary, and on line breaks Here is an example in which all three values are used: [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]

In the markup we have multiple spaces and a line break.

In the markup we have multiple spaces and a line break, but in the result multiple spaces are ignored.

In the markup we have multiple spaces and a line break.

[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b] [code format="css" codeId="536"]p.pre { [b]white-space: pre;[/b] } p.preline { [b]white-space: pre-line;[/b] } p.prewrap { [b]white-space: pre-wrap;[/b] }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2612" width="100%"] [note][b]Pre-wrap[/b] value behaves as the [b]pre[/b] value, except that it adds extra line breaks to prevent the text breaking out of the element's box.[/note]
